channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Black plastic bag contain dog fouling and dog food was thrown into my front garden., 10th July
item.description:
A black plastic bag containing dog fouling and food was thrown into my front garden. The plastic bag was split and the contents were scattered that attract flies, maggots, ants , etc. As far as I am aware, the fly tipping was carried out between 21:30 to 22:30.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Horsa Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lamps not working, 10th July
item.description:
The street lamps at the front and rear of 32 Mountbatten Close are not working. The alleyway that runs alongside no 32 is therefore in darkness. It feels unsafe to residents.

item.description:

item.title: Albert Road London NW1, 10th July
item.description:
You closed the report on FixMyStreet, ref: 7742796, stating that no further action would be taken and that this section falls under Westminster to maintain. However, I don’t understand how this can be correct when signage all along the road is from Camden. There’s one directly next to the main pothole. How can you be enforcing parking and issuing PCNs if someone parks directly over the pothole or on this road, but not be responsible for fixing it? Another point to consider is that the person reporting the issue doesn’t decide who receives the message. If you still believe this isn’t your problem to fix, you need to correct the boundaries that FixMyStreet are working with. It would also be helpful if you could forward the issue to your neighbouring borough, whom I’m sure you have contacts for.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince Albert Road, Chalk Farm, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fibre Optic cable trip hazard near school entrance, 10th July
item.description:
Coil of Fibre optic cable creating a trip hazard on the pavement right near Southborough School entrance. This is at the Telegraph pole near to the speed camera traffic island. I would contact the utility company but there is nothing to identify who it belongs to. I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///bubble.cure.stray https://w3w.co/bubble.cure.stray

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
